name: Browser Credential Theft
description: Process accessing browser credential stores (Chrome/Edge/Firefox) unexpectedly.

name: Suspicious Telegram/Discord Token Access
description: Process reading messaging app tokens — common infostealer behavior.

name: Crypto Wallet Enumeration
description: Process touches known wallet directories or extension data.

name: Suspicious File Collection
description: Process enumerating sensitive file extensions commonly stolen.

name: Exfiltration via HTTP POST
description: Suspicious POST request to untrusted IP or domain typical for infostealers.

name: C2 Using Discord Webhooks
description: Outbound connections to Discord webhook URLs.

name: C2 Using Telegram Bot API
description: Hit to Telegram Bot endpoints.

name: Self-Deleting Dropper Behavior
description: Process spawning cmd/powershell delete commands for itself.

name: Corporate Portal Credentials Exposed
description: Credentials associated with likely internal or corporate web portals (ticketing, intranet, admin, or project tools).

name: AD / SSO / IdP Credentials Exposed
description: Credentials for SSO, identity providers, or central authentication platforms (Okta, Azure AD, Google, Auth0, etc.).

name: Cloud Console / Production Credentials Exposed
description: Credentials giving access to cloud consoles or production environments (AWS, Azure, GCP, OCI, DigitalOcean, etc.).

name: Email / Exchange Admin Credentials Exposed
description: Credentials for mail admin portals or webmail entry points (O365 admin, Exchange, Zimbra, generic webmail).

name: Banking / Payment Processor Credentials Exposed
description: Credentials that appear to belong to banking portals or payment processors (merchant / gateway access).

name: Remote Access / VPN Portal Credentials Exposed
description: Credentials linked to VPNs or remote access gateways (Citrix, RDP gateways, SSL VPN, ZTNA portals).

name: Developer / CI/CD Credentials Exposed
description: Credentials tied to source control, CI/CD platforms, or artifact registries (GitHub, GitLab, Jenkins, Artifactory, etc.).

name: Privileged / Admin Account Name Patterns
description: Credentials with usernames suggesting privileged or shared admin/service accounts.

name: Corporate Credential on Consumer Services
description: Corporate-looking usernames (e.g., business email) used on consumer platforms (social, streaming, shopping).

name: Same Login Used Across Multiple Domains (Heuristic)
description: Heuristic rule for detecting reused credentials across different domains. Requires correlation logic across rows.
note: Engine should group by login/user and count distinct domains; alert if count exceeds threshold.

name: Multiple Accounts from Same Device (Infostealer Host)
description: Single host/PC has credentials for many distinct accounts or domains — classic infostealer host behavior.
note: Group by host/pc and count distinct logins/domains. Alert when volume crosses threshold (e.g., >10 accounts).

name: Same Account Across Multiple Hosts
description: Same account or email appears in credentials from multiple distinct endpoints, indicating widespread compromise or shared password reuse.
note: Group by login/user and count distinct hosts/pc; alert when exposed from >1 host.

name: High-Value Domain Credential Exposure (Generic)
description: Generic high-value credential exposure where URL or domain contains keywords for admin, payment, production, or security tooling.
